meanings.definition: The quality or state of being racy.
meanings.sent1: Her story had a touch of racinesses that made it exciting to read.
meanings.sent2: The novel's racinesses kept the readers engaged till the end.
meanings.sent3: The racinesses of the gossip at the party had everyone intrigued.
meanings.sent4: His jokes had a hint of racinesses that added spice to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The racinesses of the dance performance left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being lively or spirited.
meanings.sent1: The racinesses of her personality always brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The racinesses of the music had everyone on their feet dancing.
meanings.sent3: His racinesses in telling jokes made everyone laugh heartily.
meanings.sent4: The racinesses of the children playing in the park was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The racinesses of the debate brought energy to the discussion.

meanings.definition: The quality of being slightly improper or indecent.
meanings.sent1: The movie's racinesses made it unsuitable for young viewers.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes sometimes crossed the line into racinesses.
meanings.sent3: The racinesses of the situation made everyone blush.
meanings.sent4: Her choice of words had a hint of racinesses that shocked the audience.
meanings.sent5: The racinesses of the painting sparked a heated debate among critics.
